column2: IDAHO PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Idaho

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. Drivers may pass another vehicle on the right if the vehicle is waiting to:
column4: turn left.
column6: turn into a driveway on the right.

column2: 2. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column4: minimum speed

column2: 3. This sign indicates:
column4: Do not use your phone while driving

column2: 4. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: Both.

column2: 5. When you need to change lanes, it is important to:
column4: make sure the lane you are about to enter is clear.
column6: signal your intentions ahead of time.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: No trucks allowed

column2: 7. The yield sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop.
column6: The traffic light will soon be red.
column8: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column10: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.

column2: 8. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Do not enter.

column2: 9. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column8: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.

column2: 10. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Rounabout ahead.
column6: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column8: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column10: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 11. This sign indicates:
column4: Winding road

column2: 12. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column4: drive much faster

column2: 13. To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked on a hill, if you are facing uphill you should:
column4: turn the back wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column6: set the parking brake and keep the front wheels straight.
column8: turn the front wheels away from the curb or edge of the road.
column10: turn the front wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.

column2: 14. The yield sign means:
column4: Stop.
column8: Go. The light will soon be red.
column10: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.

column2: 15. If there are two railroad tracks next to each other:
column4: when one train passes, watch out for another train on the other track.
column6: when one train passes, proceed with caution.
column8: sound your horn as you cross the tracks.

column2: 16. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
column4: high beam lights.

column2: 17. This sign indicates:
column4: the maximum width of a vehicle allowed on the highway.
column6: the overpass ahead has a low clearance.
column10: the maximum legal height allowed in this State.

column2: 18. This sign means:
column4: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.
column6: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column8: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.

column2: 19. This road sign:
column4: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column8: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column10: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.

column2: 20. Which of the following does NOT affect the distance that it takes to stop your vehicle?
column4: Perception time.

column2: 21. You must stop for a school bus:
column4: whenever the driver waves at you.
column6: whenever the school bus approaches you, even if its lights are not flashing.
column8: if its red lights are flashing on a two-lane highway.
column10: when the school bus is parked on the shoulder of the road and no one is in it.

column2: 22. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: quickly change speed or lane position.
column6: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.
column8: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.

column2: 23. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 24. What is Idaho’s "basic rule" law for driving speed?
column4: Always drive 5 MPH below the posted speed limit just to be safe.
column6: No person shall drive a vehicle at a speed greater than is reasonable and prudent under the current conditions.
column10: Drive at the same speed as the vehicles around you.

column2: 25. To enter a freeway:
column4: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.
column6: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.
column8: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column10: drive slowly so you can check traffic.

column2: 26. When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
column4: yield to all trains at the crossing.
column8: speed up to beat the train.
column10: cross the tracks as slowly as possible.

column2: 27. When merging onto a freeway, drivers should:
column4: accelerate to the speed of the freeway traffic.
column6: merge over two lanes at once and speed up.
column8: proceed slowly while waiting for an opening.
column10: accelerate to a speed that is faster than the freeway traffic.

column2: 28. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column10: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 29. This sign means:
column4: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.
column6: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.

column2: 30. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: Whoever enters the intersection first.

column2: 31. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: can not turn left.
column6: must turn into its right lane.
column8: must go to the next intersection.
column10: must turn into its left lane.

column2: 32. To avoid being in a truck driver’s blind spot, you should:
column4: avoid driving on either side of the truck and don’t tailgate.
column10: never pass the truck and put your headlights on.

column2: 33. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column4: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.

column2: 34. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a sharp turn.

column2: 35. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column4: Remain calm and relaxed.
column6: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.

column2: 36. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column4: Warning signs

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn

column2: 38. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: increase your speed and move to the left.
column6: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column10: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.

column2: 39. The picture shows:
column4: a speeding fines doubled sign.

column2: 40. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column6: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column8: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column10: when passing is restricted by parked cars.
